abstract: A new filing again raises questions about the dealings of David Sokol, a top deputy at Berkshire who was buying Lubrizol stock at the same time he was pushing Warren Buffett to acquire it.
snippet: A new filing again raises questions about the dealings of David Sokol, a top deputy at Berkshire who was buying Lubrizol stock at the same time he was pushing Warren Buffett to acquire it.
lead_paragraph: Warren E. Buffett said he “held back nothing” in a letter announcing the resignation of David L. Sokol, a top Berkshire Hathaway manager.

headline.main: Disclosure Sheds New Light on Sokol Timeline
